title: As US debates Title 42 policy, asylum seekers left in limbo
description: The Supreme Court intervened on Monday to block the controversial immigration policy's scheduled expiration this week.

title: US manufacturer Honeywell to pay $200m to settle bribery charges
description: Parallel investigations were for bribes that Honeywell paid from 2010 to 2014 to get business from Brazil's Petrobras.

title: Proud Boys trial moves forward as January 6 panel prepares report
description: Defence lawyers previously called for jury selection to be postponed to 2023 due to 'combustible' political climate.

title: US seeks to bolster Ecuador ties as China expands regional role
description: Joe Biden says US will seek to expand relationship with Ecuador as President Guillermo Lasso visits White House.

title: What’s gone wrong with the UK’s National Health Service?
description: NHS healthcare staff calling for better pay and work conditions are pushing ahead with another round of strikes.

title: Sudanese security forces tear-gas pro-democracy protesters
description: Thousands of demonstrator in Khartoum demand an end to military rule and justice for those killed since last year's coup

title: UN chief promises ‘no-nonsense’ climate summit in 2023
description: Secretary General Antonio Guterres warns that governments have fallen short of their emission reduction targets.

title: England cruise towards test history as Ahmed destroys Pakistan
description: Rehan Ahmed, aged just 18, took five wickets and left England on the brink of historic victory.

title: US Capitol riot: Lawmakers recommend filing charges against Trump
description: Congressional panel urges Justice Department to indict ex-president for inciting insurrection, among other charges.

title: Fortnite creator Epic Games to pay record fine
description: It will pay for violating a children's privacy law and tricking users to make purchases they did not intend to make.

title: EU countries agree gas price cap to battle energy crisis
description: The 27-nation bloc has agreed to trigger a cap if gas prices exceed 180 euros per megawatt hour for three days.

title: Staff picks: My favourite World Cup 2022 moment
description: From Morocco's fairytale journey to Japan fans cleaning up after the match, here are a few highlights of the World Cup.

title: Analysis: Six key takeaways from the Qatar World Cup
description: From the end of Messi's wait for glory to the first Arab tournament, and the mixing of politics and sports.

title: Karim Benzema calls full time on international football career
description: The 35-year-old Real Madrid striker missed France's attempted defence of their World Cup title due to injury.

title: Tunisia’s election: The beginning of the end for Saeid
description: Saturday's sham election will not be able to save President Saeid's authoritarian regime.

title: Colombia’s ELN rebels announce end-of-year ceasefire
description: Truce will last from Saturday to January 2, leftist rebels say, as peace talks with Bogota to resume next month.

title: South Africa’s Ramaphosa re-elected as leader of ruling ANC party
description: The party conference has been marked by divisions and scandals surrounding Ramaphosa and his rival Zweli Mkhize.

title: Palestinian-American to be released after Israeli detention
description: Hala Kasim Salameh's family said she had a permit to enter Jerusalem but was arrested by Israeli authorities.

title: Netherlands apologises for Dutch government’s role in slavery
description: PM Mark Rutte says the Dutch state has enabled, stimulated and profited from slavery for centuries.

title: Putin makes rare visit to Minsk for talks with Belarus leader
description: Kremlin rejects claims that the Russian president is pressuring Belarus into a more active role in the war in Ukraine.

title: Thailand navy searches for 31 missing sailors after warship sinks
description: Naval vessel HTMS Sukhothai capsizes in high waves late on Sunday while patrolling the Gulf of Thailand.

title: Malaysia PM Anwar Ibrahim wins motion of confidence in parliament
description: The win is vital backing for Anwar's premiership after an election last month returned an unprecedented hung parliament.

title: Tunisia set for runoffs after low turnout parliamentary elections
description: Only 21 candidates secured victory in the first round of votes marked by low turnout, electoral commission says.

title: Iran says four security forces killed near Pakistan border
description: Members of Iran's security forces killed in a firefight with an unnamed 'terrorist group', state media reports.

title: The morning after: Qatar wakes up to post World Cup life
description: People express sadness over the World Cup ending but say they feel privileged to have been a part of it.

title: Sri Lanka navy rescues over 100 Rohingya adrift in rough seas
description: Navy says 104 people found on board a trawler suspected to have originated from Myanmar and heading to Indonesia.

title: UK’s bid to send asylum seekers to Rwanda is ‘lawful’: High Court
description: Judges say the UK government’s controversial plan to send asylum seekers on a one-way trip to Rwanda is legal.

title: ‘Pure joy’: Argentina erupts in celebration after World Cup win
description: An explosion of hope and joy engulfs the nation after their team, led by Messi, won the World Cup on Sunday.

title: Hostages taken at Pakistan counterterrorism centre seized by TTP
description: Standoff continues after Pakistani Taliban men overpower guards, snatch weapons and take hostages at facility in Bannu.

title: Countries seal deal to protect nature despite DRC objection
description: As part of the agreement, countries committed to protect 30 percent of land and water considered ecologically vital.

title: Sweden’s top court blocks Turkish journalist’s extradition
description: The extradition of Bulent Kenes is a key demand by Ankara to ratify Stockholm's NATO membership.

title: Photos: Peaceful polls, coups, droughts mark Africa in 2022
description: Conflicts within and outside Africa impacted the continent in 2022, but multiple peaceful transitions offered hope.

title: Lionel Messi: A breakdown of his World Cup and career highlights
description: After inspiring Argentina to a historic World Cup victory in Qatar, we look back at his illustrious career.

title: Where do Palestinians stand on the war in Ukraine?
description: Palestinians have been accused of being pro-Russia. But they are just tired of never-ending Western hypocrisy.

title: World Cup predictions: How many games did our AI get right?
description: In total, Kashef had a 67 percent accuracy level, but failed to predict Argentina as the 2022 World Cup winners.

title: 11 people seriously injured by turbulence on Hawaii flight
description: At least one person was reported to have been rendered unconscious but all patients were awake and talking.

title: What is a bisht and why was Messi wearing it at the World Cup?
description: Emir of Qatar put a bisht on Argentina captain Messi during the World Cup closing ceremony.

title: Mexico and the unbearable whiteness of advertising
description: From beers to cars to supermarkets, Mexico and other postcolonial societies are grappling with a whiteness epidemic.

title: Five dead, suspect killed in Toronto area shooting
description: The attack took place in different apartments in the same building and one wounded person was taken to a hospital.

title: Russia drone attack targets ‘critical infrastructure’ in Kyiv
description: Ukraine's military says about 20 unmanned aerial vehicles targeted facilities around the capital.

title: Three Jordanian police killed during raid on hideout in Maan
description: Police officers died during a raid on the suspected killers of a senior Jordanian police officer who died on Friday.

title: Argentina’s fans celebrate in the streets after World Cup victory
description: 'This team made people fall in love with them for the first time in decades,' an Argentinian fan said.

title: Dozens of sailors missing after Thai navy ship sinks
description: The HTMS Sukhothai was carrying 106 people when it sank in choppy waters in the Gulf of Thailand, the navy says.

title: Elon Musk asks Twitter to vote on whether he should step down
description: Musk runs Twitter poll on his leadership after backlash to new policy banning 'free promotion' of other platforms.

title: South Korea warns of deepening economic slump
description: Asia's fourth-largest economy is widely expected to see growth fall below 2 percent next year.

title: UK’s PM Sunak to announce $304m in new military aid for Ukraine
description: PM's office says the new package will include 'hundreds of thousands of rounds of artillery' for use against Russia.

title: Kyiv slams Kissinger over call to negotiate with Russia for peace
description: 'For all its propensity to violence, Russia has made decisive contributions to the global equilibrium': Henry Kissinger.

title: As ‘zero-COVID’ unravels, some Chinese still fear travel abroad
description: Chinese spent $288bn on international travel in 2018, nearly one-quarter of the global spending on tourism.

title: ‘We fought until the end’: French World Cup fans sing Les Bleus
description: "Les Bleus made us dream," President Emmanuel Macron said after France’s dramatic World Cup final loss to Argentina.

title: Photos: World Cup victory parade takes to the street in Qatar
description: Joyous crowds lined Lusail Boulevard in Qatar following the conclusion of an incredible World Cup final.

title: N Korea completes ‘important’ test of spy satellite: State media
description: N Korea has released satellite imagery of South Korea's Seoul and Incheon cities presumed to have been shot during test.
